intro: Lunathyrium bonincola, commonly known as the Bonin Islands moonflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments, often near coastal areas. Its blooming period occurs during the summer months, and it is noted for its nocturnal flowering habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
